conbody.p: This document introduces you to the Subtitle Graphic library.

section.title: Purpose
section.p: Subtitle Graphic is used to add subtitle CRP for Multimedia Framework (MMF).
The Dynamic Link Library (DLL) that provides the Subtitle Graphic functionality and the library to which your code must include is identified in the table below.

entry.p: These files are necessary to implement Subtitle Graphic functionality.

section.title: Architectural relationship
section.p: Subtitle Graphic is key library for the Video Subtitle CRP component to interact with MMF.

section.title: Description
section.p: Subtitle Graphic displays subtitles artwork on the screen through its interaction with Client Process, Controller Process and WServ Process. For information about Client Process, Controller Process and WServ see Architectural relationship session in Video Subtitle CRP Overview.

In Client Process, the Client Application passes a subtitle support request to the Video Client API. In Controller Process, the Video Player Controller gets notified by MMF to handle the corresponding subtitle commands and stream.

The subtitle commands and stream are decoded and rendered in Controller Process and sent to WServ Process. Video Player Controller provides artwork for Video Subtitle CRP to render content to the application window within WServ Process.

section.p: You can initialise and use the functionality to display subtitles artwork on a video window.
